intro: Adhatoda tetramera, commonly known as the four-parted adenophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Adhatoda tetramera is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
